entry.title: The Legal Services Act 2007 (The Law Society and The Council for Licensed Conveyancers) (Modification of Functions) Order 2011

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Legal Services Act 2007 (The Law Society and The Council for Licensed Conveyancers) (Modification of Functions) Order 2011

entry.summary: This Order makes provision about the functions of the Law Society (“the Society”) and the Council for Licensed Conveyancers (“the Council”). It modifies the Solicitors Act 1974 (c.47) (“the 1974 Act”) and amends the Administration of Justice Act 1985 (c.61) (“the 1985 Act”).

title.div: The Scheme for Construction Contracts (England and Wales) Regulations 1998 (Amendment) (Wales) Regulations 2011 / Rheoliadau Rheoliadau Cynllun Contractau Adeiladu (Cymru a Lloegr) 1998 (Diwygio) (Cymru) 2011

div.p: These Regulations amend the Scheme for Construction Contracts (England and Wales) Regulations 1998 (S.I. 1998/649) (“the Scheme”), in part to reflect changes made to the relevant primary legislation, the Housing Grants, Construction and Regeneration Act 1996 (c. 53) (“the 1996 Act”), by the Local Democracy, Economic Development and Construction Act 2009 (c. 20) (“the 2009 Act”), and in part to reflect changes which the Construction Umbrella Bodies Adjudication Task Group has suggested would be desirable.

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn diwygio Rheoliadau Cynllun Contractau Adeiladu (Cymru a Lloegr) 1998 (O.S. 1998/649) (“y Cynllun”), yn rhannol i adlewyrchu newidiadau a wnaed i'r ddeddfwriaeth sylfaenol berthnasol, sef Deddf Grantiau Tai, Adeiladu ac Adfywio 1996 (p.53) (“Deddf 1996”), gan Ddeddf Democratiaeth Leol, Datblygu Economaidd ac Adeiladu 2009 (p.20) (“Deddf 2009”), ac yn rhannol i adlewyrchu newidiadau yr awgrymodd Grŵp Gorchwyl Dyfarnu Cyrff Ymbarél y Diwydiant Adeiladu y byddent yn ddymunol.

title.div: The Poultrymeat (Wales) Regulations 2011 / Rheoliadau Cig Dofednod (Cymru) 2011

div.p: These Regulations which apply in relation to Wales make provision for the enforcement and execution of directly applicable EU (European Union) marketing standards relating to poultrymeat.
Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn gymwys o ran Cymru ac yn gwneud darpariaeth ar gyfer gorfodi a gweithredu safonau marchnata uniongyrchol gymwysadwy yr UE (Undeb Ewropeaidd) mewn perthynas â chig dofednod.

entry.title: The Horserace Betting and Olympic Lottery Act 2004 (Appointed Day) Order 2011

title.div: The National Health Service (Concerns, Complaints and Redress Arrangements) (Wales) (Amendment) Regulations 2011 / Rheoliadau'r Gwasanaeth Iechyd Gwladol (Trefniadau Pryderon, Cwynion ac Iawn) (Cymru) (Diwygio) 2011

div.p: These Regulations amend the National Health Service (Concerns, Complaints and Redress Arrangements) (Wales) Regulations 2011 (“the principal Regulations”).
Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn diwygio Rheoliadau'r Gwasanaeth Iechyd Gwladol (Trefniadau Pryderon, Cwynion ac Iawn) (Cymru) 2011 (“y prif Reoliadau”).

entry.title: The Horserace Betting and Olympic Lottery Act 2004 (Commencement No.5) Order 2011
entry.summary: This Order brings into force certain provisions of The Horserace Betting and Olympic Lottery Act 2004 on 13th July 2011. Section 13 of that Act makes provision that certain consequential amendments in Schedule 2 shall have effect following the dissolution of the Horserace Totalisator Board (the Tote) and the transfer of its property, rights and liabilities to the successor company. Section 38 repeals certain enactments to the extent specified in Schedule 6. Schedule 2 and Schedule 6 of the Act have not been commenced fully because certain of the consequential amendments and repeals have been rendered obsolete by subsequent legislation or concern Part 2 of the Act (Abolition of the Horserace Betting Levy System).

entry.title: The Humber Bridge (Debts) Order 2011
entry.summary: This Order releases the Humber Bridge Board from its obligation to pay the Secretary of State for Transport a proportion of interest arising under agreements for the financing of the construction and maintenance of the Humber Bridge.

ukm:Subject.Value: JUSTICES OF THE PEACE, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: JUSTICES OF THE PEACE, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.title: The Employment and Support Allowance (Work-related Activity) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations are made under the provisions in Part 1 of the Welfare Reform Act (Northern Ireland) 2007. Section 13 of that Act introduced work-related activity requirements for claimants of employment and support allowance who are not in the “support group” (defined in section 24(4) as a person in respect of whom it is determined that they have, or are to be treated as having, limited capability for work-related activity).

entry.title: The Church of England Pensions (Sodor and Man) (Amendment) Regulations 2011
The Justice and Security (Northern Ireland) Act 2007 (Extension of duration of non-jury trial provisions) Order 2011

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Justice and Security (Northern Ireland) Act 2007 (Extension of duration of non-jury trial provisions) Order 2011

entry.title: The Railways (Safety Management) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations transpose certain provisions of Directive 2008/110/EC (the “Revised Safety Directive”) amending Directive 2004/49/EC (the “Railway Safety Directive”) on safety on the Community’s railways. (The Railway Safety Directive was transposed by the Railways (Safety Management) Regulations 2006 (“the Safety Management Regulations”). The transposition of the Revised Safety Directive provisions is effected by amendments to the Safety Management Regulations.

entry.title: The Ecclesiastical Judges, Legal Officers and Others (Fees) Order 2011
entry.summary: This Order increases the fees fixed by Table I of the Ecclesiastical Judges, Legal Officers and Others (Fees) Order 2010 (“the 2010 Order”) in relation to faculty proceedings (including proceedings in cases under the Care of Places of Worship Measure 1999), proceedings for an injunction or a restoration order under section 13(4) and (5) of the Care of Churches and Ecclesiastical Jurisdiction Measure 1991 (including appeals) and proceedings under section 4 of the Care of Cathedrals (Supplementary Provisions) Measure 1994 (including appeals), and the fees fixed by Table III of the 2010 Order for proceedings in respect of ecclesiastical offences under the Ecclesiastical Jurisdiction Measure 1963, including the provision for all cases where proceedings have been instituted under that Measure or where a person has been authorised to lay a complaint under the Measure, and appeals and the fees established by Table IV for proceedings under the Clergy Discipline Measure 2003.

entry.title: The Charities (Interim Manager) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision in respect of an interim manager appointed by order of the Charity Commission for Northern Ireland (“the Commission”) under section 33(1)(vii) of the Charities Act (Northern Ireland) 2008 (“the Act”).

entry.title: The Welfare Reform (2007 Act) (Commencement No. 9) Order (Northern Ireland) 2011
entry.summary: This Order provides for the coming into operation of the following provisions of the Welfare Reform Act (Northern Ireland) 2007—

entry.title: The Legal Officers (Annual Fees) Order 2011
entry.summary: This Order applies an increase of 2.55% (a weighted inflationary formula of 25% RPI and 75% AWE (4.8% and 1.8% respectively in 2010)) to the total of the annual fees for diocesan registrars fixed by the Legal Officers (Annual Fees) Order 2010. The increased total is then apportioned as to each registrar’s individual fee according to a formula based on the number of parishes and stipendiary clergy in each diocese.

entry.title: The Parliamentary Voting System and Constituencies Act 2011 (Repeal of Alternative Vote Provisions) Order 2011
The Leeds College of Art (Transfer to the Higher Education Sector) Order 2011
The Leeds College of Music (Dissolution) Order 2011
The Joseph Priestley College, Leeds (Dissolution) Order 2011
entry.summary: This Order dissolves with effect from 1st August 2011 the further education corporation established to conduct Joseph Priestley College, Leeds. It provides for the transfer of its property, rights and liabilities to Leeds City College and secures the rights of its employees by applying section 26(2) to (4) of the Further and Higher Education Act 1992.
